012package org.postgresql.pljava.example.annotation;

014import java.lang.reflect.Method;
015import static java.lang.reflect.Modifier.isPublic;
016
017import java.sql.Connection;
018import static java.sql.DriverManager.getConnection;
019import java.sql.PreparedStatement;
020import java.sql.ResultSet;
021import java.sql.SQLException;
022import java.sql.SQLXML;
023import java.sql.Statement;
024
025import java.util.ArrayList;
026import java.util.Arrays;
027import java.util.Comparator;
028import java.util.Iterator;
029import java.util.List;
030import java.util.Objects;
031import java.util.Optional;
032
033import java.util.logging.Logger;
034import java.util.logging.Level;
035import static java.util.logging.Level.INFO;
036import static java.util.logging.Level.WARNING;
037
038import static java.util.stream.Collectors.joining;
039import static java.util.stream.Collectors.toList;
040import java.util.stream.Stream;
041
042import org.postgresql.pljava.Adapter.As;
043import org.postgresql.pljava.ResultSetProvider;
044import org.postgresql.pljava.TargetList.Cursor;
045import org.postgresql.pljava.TargetList.Projection;
046
047import org.postgresql.pljava.annotation.Function;
048import org.postgresql.pljava.annotation.SQLAction;
049import org.postgresql.pljava.annotation.SQLType;
050
051import org.postgresql.pljava.model.CatalogObject;
052import org.postgresql.pljava.model.CatalogObject.Addressed;
053import org.postgresql.pljava.model.CatalogObject.Named;
054import org.postgresql.pljava.model.Portal;
055import static org.postgresql.pljava.model.Portal.ALL;
056import static org.postgresql.pljava.model.Portal.Direction.FORWARD;
057import org.postgresql.pljava.model.ProceduralLanguage;
058import org.postgresql.pljava.model.RegClass;
059import org.postgresql.pljava.model.RegClass.Known;
060import org.postgresql.pljava.model.RegProcedure;
061import org.postgresql.pljava.model.RegType;
062import org.postgresql.pljava.model.SlotTester;
063import org.postgresql.pljava.model.Trigger;
064import org.postgresql.pljava.model.TupleTableSlot;
065
066/**
067 * A test that PL/Java's various {@link CatalogObject} implementations are
068 * usable.
069 *<p>
070 * They rely on named attributes, in PostgreSQL's system catalogs, that are
071 * looked up at class initialization, so on a PostgreSQL version that may not
072 * supply all the expected attributes, the issue may not be detected until
073 * an affected {@code CatalogObject} subclass is first used. This test uses as
074 * many of them as it can.
075 */
076@SQLAction(requires="catalogClasses function", install=
077    "SELECT javatest.catalogClasses()"
078)
079@SQLAction(requires="catalogInval function", install=
080    "SELECT javatest.catalogInval()"
081)
082public class CatalogObjects {
083    static final Logger logr = Logger.getAnonymousLogger();
084
085    static void log(Level v, String m, Object... p)
086    {
087        logr.log(v, m, p);
088    }
089
090    static final As<CatalogObject     ,?> CatObjAdapter;
091    static final As<ProceduralLanguage,?> PrLangAdapter;
092    static final As<RegClass          ,?> RegClsAdapter;
093    static final As<RegProcedure<?>   ,?> RegPrcAdapter;
094    static final As<RegType           ,?> RegTypAdapter;
095
096    static
097    {
098        try
099        {
100            Connection conn = getConnection("jdbc:default:connection");
101
102            // Get access to the hacked-together interim testing API
103            SlotTester t = conn.unwrap(SlotTester.class);
104
105            String cls = "org.postgresql.pljava.pg.adt.OidAdapter";
106
107                    @SuppressWarnings("unchecked") Object _1 =
108            CatObjAdapter =
109                (As<CatalogObject,?>)t.adapterPlease(cls, "INSTANCE");
110                    @SuppressWarnings("unchecked") Object _2 =
111            PrLangAdapter =
112                (As<ProceduralLanguage,?>)t.adapterPlease(cls,"PLANG_INSTANCE");
113            RegClsAdapter =
114                (As<RegClass,?>)t.adapterPlease(cls, "REGCLASS_INSTANCE");
115            RegPrcAdapter =
116                (As<RegProcedure<?>,?>)t.adapterPlease(
117                    cls, "REGPROCEDURE_INSTANCE");
118            RegTypAdapter =
119                (As<RegType,?>)t.adapterPlease(cls, "REGTYPE_INSTANCE");
120        }
121        catch ( SQLException | ReflectiveOperationException e )
122        {
123            throw new ExceptionInInitializerError(e);
124        }
125    }
126
127    @Function(schema="javatest", provides="catalogInval function")
128    public static void catalogInval() throws SQLException
129    {
130        try (
131            Connection conn = getConnection("jdbc:default:connection");
132            Statement s = conn.createStatement();
133        )
134        {
135            SlotTester st = conn.unwrap(SlotTester.class);
136            CatalogObject catObj;
137            String description1;
138            String description2;
139            boolean passing = true;
140
141            s.executeUpdate("CREATE TABLE tbl_a ()");
142            catObj = findObj(s, st, RegClsAdapter,
143                "SELECT CAST ('tbl_a' AS pg_catalog.regclass)");
144            description1 = catObj.toString();
145            s.executeUpdate("ALTER TABLE tbl_a RENAME TO tbl_b");
146            description2 = catObj.toString();
147            if ( ! description2.equals(description1.replace("tbl_a", "tbl_b")) )
148            {
149                log(WARNING, "RegClass before/after rename: {0} / {1}",
150                    description1, description2);
151                passing = false;
152            }
153            s.executeUpdate("DROP TABLE tbl_b");
154            description1 = catObj.toString();
155            if ( ! description2.matches("\\Q"+description1+"\\E(?<=]).*") )
156            {
157                log(WARNING, "RegClass before/after drop: {1} / {0}",
158                    description1, description2);
159                passing = false;
160            }
161
162            s.executeQuery(
163                "SELECT sqlj.alias_java_language('lng_a', sandboxed => true)")
164                .next();
165            catObj = findObj(s, st, PrLangAdapter,
166                "SELECT oid FROM pg_catalog.pg_language " +
167                "WHERE lanname OPERATOR(pg_catalog.=) 'lng_a'");
168            description1 = catObj.toString();
169            s.executeUpdate("ALTER LANGUAGE lng_a RENAME TO lng_b");
170            description2 = catObj.toString();
171            if ( ! description2.equals(description1.replace("lng_a", "lng_b")) )
172            {
173                log(WARNING,
174                    "ProceduralLanguage before/after rename: {0} / {1}",
175                    description1, description2);
176                passing = false;
177            }
178            s.executeUpdate("DROP LANGUAGE lng_b");
179            description1 = catObj.toString();
180            if ( ! description2.matches("\\Q"+description1+"\\E(?<=]).*") )
181            {
182                log(WARNING, "ProceduralLanguage before/after drop: {1} / {0}",
183                    description1, description2);
184                passing = false;
185            }
186
187            s.executeUpdate(
188                "CREATE FUNCTION fn_a() RETURNS INTEGER LANGUAGE SQL " +
189                "AS 'SELECT 1'");
190            catObj = findObj(s, st, RegPrcAdapter,
191                "SELECT CAST ('fn_a()' AS pg_catalog.regprocedure)");
192            description1 = catObj.toString();
193            s.executeUpdate("ALTER FUNCTION fn_a RENAME TO fn_b");
194            description2 = catObj.toString();
195            if ( ! description2.equals(description1.replace("fn_a", "fn_b")) )
196            {
197                log(WARNING, "RegProcedure before/after rename: {0} / {1}",
198                    description1, description2);
199                passing = false;
200            }
201            s.executeUpdate("DROP FUNCTION fn_b");
202            description1 = catObj.toString();
203            if ( ! description2.matches("\\Q"+description1+"\\E(?<=]).*") )
204            {
205                log(WARNING, "RegProcedure before/after drop: {1} / {0}",
206                    description1, description2);
207                passing = false;
208            }
209
210            s.executeUpdate("CREATE TYPE typ_a AS ()");
211            catObj = findObj(s, st, RegTypAdapter,
212                "SELECT CAST ('typ_a' AS pg_catalog.regtype)");
213            description1 = catObj.toString();
214            s.executeUpdate("ALTER TYPE typ_a RENAME TO typ_b");
215            description2 = catObj.toString();
216            if ( ! description2.equals(description1.replace("typ_a", "typ_b")) )
217            {
218                log(WARNING, "RegType before/after rename: {0} / {1}",
219                    description1, description2);
220                passing = false;
221            }
222            s.executeUpdate("DROP TYPE typ_b");
223            description1 = catObj.toString();
224            if ( ! description2.matches("\\Q"+description1+"\\E(?<=]).*") )
225            {
226                log(WARNING, "RegType before/after drop: {1} / {0}",
227                    description1, description2);
228                passing = false;
229            }
230
231            if ( passing )
232                log(INFO, "selective invalidation ok");
233        }
234    }
235
236    private static <T extends CatalogObject.Addressed<T>> T findObj(
237        Statement s, SlotTester st, As<? extends T,?> adapter, String query)
238    throws SQLException
239    {
240        try (
241            Portal p = st.unwrapAsPortal(s.executeQuery(query))
242        )
243        {
244            return
245                p.tupleDescriptor().applyOver(p.fetch(FORWARD, 1), c0 -> c0
246                    .stream()
247                    .map(c -> c.apply(adapter, o -> o))
248                    .findFirst().get());
249        }
250    }
251
252    @Function(schema="javatest", provides="catalogClasses function")
253    public static void catalogClasses() throws SQLException
254    {
255        String catalogRelationsQuery =
256            "SELECT" +
257            "  oid" +
258            " FROM" +
259            "  pg_catalog.pg_class" +
260            " WHERE" +
261            "   relnamespace = CAST ('pg_catalog' AS pg_catalog.regnamespace)" +
262            "  AND" +
263            "   relkind = 'r'";
264
265        try (
266            Connection conn = getConnection("jdbc:default:connection");
267            Statement s = conn.createStatement();
268        )
269        {
270            SlotTester st = conn.unwrap(SlotTester.class);
271
272            List<Known> knownRegClasses;
273
274            try (
275                Portal p =
276                    st.unwrapAsPortal(s.executeQuery(catalogRelationsQuery))
277            )
278            {
279                Projection proj = p.tupleDescriptor();
280                List<TupleTableSlot> tups = p.fetch(FORWARD, ALL);
281
282                Class<Known> knownCls = Known.class;
283
284                knownRegClasses =
285                    proj.applyOver(tups, c0 -> c0.stream()
286                        .map(c -> c.apply(RegClsAdapter, regcls -> regcls))
287                        .filter(knownCls::isInstance)
288                        .map(knownCls::cast)
289                        .collect(toList())
290                    );
291            }
292
293            int passed = 0;
294            int untested = 0;
295
296            for ( Known regc : knownRegClasses )
297            {
298                String objectQuery =
299                    "SELECT oid FROM " + regc.qualifiedName() + " LIMIT 1";
300
301                Class<? extends Addressed> classUnderTest = null;
302
303                try (
304                    Portal p =
305                        st.unwrapAsPortal(s.executeQuery(objectQuery))
306                )
307                {
308                    Projection proj = p.tupleDescriptor();
309                    List<TupleTableSlot> tups = p.fetch(FORWARD, ALL);
310                    Optional<CatalogObject> cobj =
311                        proj.applyOver(tups, c0 -> c0.stream()
312                            .map(c -> c.apply(CatObjAdapter, o -> o))
313                            .findAny());
314
315                    if ( ! cobj.isPresent() )
316                    {
317                        log(INFO,
318                            "database has no {0} objects " +
319                            " for representation test", regc.name());
320                        ++ untested;
321                        continue;
322                    }
323
324                    Addressed aobj = cobj.get().of(regc);
325
326                    classUnderTest = aobj.getClass();
327
328                    if ( aobj instanceof Named )
329                    {
330                        if ( aobj instanceof Trigger ) // name() won't work here
331                            aobj.exists();
332                        else
333                            ((Named)aobj).name();
334                        ++ passed;
335                        continue;
336                    }
337
338                    log(INFO,
339                        "{0} untested, not instance of Named " +
340                        "(does implement {1})",
341                        classUnderTest.getCanonicalName().substring(
342                            1 + classUnderTest.getPackageName().length()),
343                        Arrays.stream(classUnderTest.getInterfaces())
344                            .map(Class::getSimpleName)
345                            .collect(joining(", "))
346                    );
347                }
348                catch ( LinkageError e )
349                {
350                    Throwable t = e.getCause();
351                    if ( null == t )
352                        t = e;
353                    log(WARNING,
354                        "{0} failed initialization: {1}",
355                        classUnderTest.getName().substring(
356                            1 + classUnderTest.getPackageName().length()),
357                        t.getMessage());
358                }
359            }
360
361            log((knownRegClasses.size() == passed + untested)? INFO : WARNING,
362                "of {0} catalog representations, {1} worked " +
363                "and {2} could not be tested",
364                knownRegClasses.size(), passed, untested);
365        }
366    }
367
368    private static boolean engulfs(Class<?> a, Class<?> b)
369    {
370        return a.isAssignableFrom(b)  ||  a == b.getDeclaringClass();
371    }
372
373    static final Comparator<Class<?>>
374        partialByEngulfs = (a,b) -> engulfs(a,b) ? 1 : engulfs(b,a) ? -1 : 0;
375
376    /**
377     * Given a PostgreSQL classid and objid, obtains the corresponding Java
378     * CatalogObject, then finds the no-parameter, non-void-returning methods
379     * of all the CatalogObject interfaces it implements, and returns a table
380     * with the results of calling those methods.
381     */
382    @Function(
383        schema="javatest",
384        out={ "interface text", "method text", "result text", "exception text" }
385    )
386    public static ResultSetProvider catalogIntrospect(
387        @SQLType("regclass") CatalogObject cls, CatalogObject obj)
388    throws SQLException
389    {
390        cls = cls.of(RegClass.CLASSID);
391        if ( ! ( cls instanceof Known<?> ) )
392            throw new SQLException(
393                "Not a supported known catalog class: " + cls);
394
395        Known<?> kcls = (Known<?>)cls;
396        Addressed<?> aobj = obj.of(kcls);
397
398        Class clazz = aobj.getClass();
399
400        Stream<Method> s =
401            Stream.iterate(
402                (new Class<?>[] { clazz }), (a -> 0 < a.length), a ->
403                (
404                    Arrays.stream(a)
405                    .flatMap(c ->
406                        Stream.concat(
407                            (c.isInterface() ?
408                            Stream.of() : Stream.of(c.getSuperclass())),
409                            Arrays.stream(c.getInterfaces())
410                        )
411                    )
412                    .filter(Objects::nonNull)
413                    .toArray(Class<?>[]::new)
414                )
415            )
416            .flatMap(Arrays::stream)
417            .filter(c -> c.isInterface() && engulfs(CatalogObject.class, c))
418            .sorted(partialByEngulfs.thenComparing(Class::getSimpleName))
419            .distinct()
420            .filter(i -> CatalogObject.class.getModule().equals(i.getModule()))
421            .filter(i -> isPublic(i.getModifiers()))
422            .flatMap(i ->
423            {
424                return Arrays.stream(i.getMethods())
425                    .filter(m -> i == m.getDeclaringClass());
426            })
427            .filter(m -> void.class != m.getReturnType())
428            .filter(m -> 0 == m.getParameterCount())
429            .filter(m -> ! (m.isSynthetic()));
430
431        Iterator<Method> itr = s.iterator();
432
433        return new ResultSetProvider.Large()
434        {
435            @Override public boolean assignRowValues(ResultSet r, long rownum)
436            throws SQLException
437            {
438                if ( ! itr.hasNext() )
439                    return false;
440
441                Method m = itr.next();
442                r.updateString(1, m.getDeclaringClass().getSimpleName());
443                r.updateString(2, m.getName());
444
445                try
446                {
447                    Object v = m.invoke(aobj);
448                    String text;
449                    if ( v instanceof SQLXML )
450                        text = ((SQLXML)v).getString();
451                    else
452                        text = Objects.toString(v);
453                    r.updateString(3, text);
454                }
455                catch ( Throwable t )
456                {
457                    String s =
458                        Stream.iterate(t, Objects::nonNull, Throwable::getCause)
459                        .dropWhile(
460                            ReflectiveOperationException.class::isInstance)
461                        .map(Object::toString)
462                        .collect(joining("\n"));
463                    r.updateString(4, s);
464                }
465
466                return true;
467            }
468
469            @Override public void close() { s.close(); }
470        };
471    }
472}
